main event: Multiple observations of unidentified aerial phenomena in Dallas, Texas on 21 May 1949 by several witnesses, reporting various shapes, sizes, and speeds.
interesting points: One report indicated a sighting of 75-100 objects appearing to travel at high speeds in a brief span of 3 seconds., Witnesses described objects that appeared as bright spots in the sky with colors ranging from white to green., Observers noted different shapes such as circular, arrowhead, and flat surfaces., The weather conditions at the time were clear with high visibility, allowing for good observational clarity., The phenomenon included reports of gentle rises in altitude before fading from sight.
sighted object: unidentified aerial objects varying in number and characteristics
witness description: Various individuals, including an agriculture teacher and a housewife, noted for their average to above-average intelligence.
